text: Cameron Phelps (born 11 February 1985) is an Australian former professional rugby league footballer who last played for the Widnes Vikings in the Super League. He played as a and a . ==Playing career== Phelps made his first grade debut for Canterbury in 2005 against Manly. Phelps spent 4 years at Canterbury but mainly played in reserve grade. In 2008, Phelps joined English side Wigan. Phelps was released by Wigan in 2010 and signed for Hull F.C. on 9 February 2011. Phelps made 20 appearances and scoring 3 tries for Hull in the 2011 season but was released from contract. Phelps signed a two year Super League contract with Widnes on 20 January 2012. He returned to Australia in 2015. Following in the footsteps of his successful older brother James, who writes for Sydney's The Daily Telegraph and is an award-winning novelist, Cameron writes for Mail Online. ==References== == External links == *Bulldogs profile *Official NRL profile * Cameron Phelps Wigan Career Page on the Wigan RL Fansite. title: Cameron Phelps
